arts.ttl: Leeds United to miss out as Brighton chase one of Euro league’s most expensive ever deals
arts.sum: Leeds United were said to be one of the multiple UK clubs sending scouts to watch Hammarby sensation Bazoumana Toure this season, but Brighton appear to have won the race. Back in October, Leeds were one of multiple English clubs reported to have sent scouts to keep tabs on winger Bazoumana Toure.

arts.ttl: Leeds United Championship state of play after Sheffield United and Sunderland results
arts.sum: Leeds United scored a late equaliser to earn a point from their clash against Preston North End in Saturday’s early kick-off. Get Leeds United news to your phone with our WhatsApp community

arts.ttl: Paul Heckingbottom: Leeds United were “lucky” to draw v Preston
arts.sum: Paul Heckingbottom: Leeds needed lucky goal to draw Leeds United needed an own goal late in the day to take a point back to West Yorkshire as they drew with Preston on Saturday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke sends message to Preston man after Leeds United flashpoint
arts.sum: Referee John Busby awarded Leeds a free-kick, but inexplicably kept his cards in his pocket to spare Whiteman from an early bath, and Paul Heckingbottom knew he was lucky to keep 11 on the pitch as he subbed Whiteman for the second half. Leeds United were unable to pick up three points away at Preston on Saturday afternoon as a late Jack Whatmough own goal salvaged a draw, but the home side should have been down to 10 in the first half.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Last-gasp Preston own goal saves draw for Leeds
arts.sum: Coventry beat Hull in first home win under Lampard Bristol City and QPR share the points at Ashton Gate Jack Whatmough put through his own net right at the death to deny Preston a hard-fought victory over Leeds. The 28-year-old came on to help preserve a point but prodded Dan James’s cross into his own goal in the 93rd minute, resulting in a 1-1 draw. Brad Potts had bagged the 23rd-minute opener but it was not meant to be for the hosts, who battled hard until the end but just fell short against the promotion-chasing visitors. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke fumes over yellow card after hard-fought Preston North End draw
arts.sum: Leeds United boss Daniel Farke says he is struggling to explain why he received a yellow card in the 1-1 draw with Preston North-End, but midfielder Ben Whiteman remained on the pitch after a poor challenge. The Whites boss was speaking with the fourth official to ask why Whiteman had not been shown a yellow card for a late challenge on Jayden Bogle on the edge of the 18-yard box.

arts.ttl: 0 key passes: It took Daniel Farke 65 minutes too long to make obvious double-Leeds United change
arts.sum: Leeds United needed a last-gasp own goal to salvage a point away at Preston amidst another alarmingly bad display on their travels. It took Farke until the 65th minute to diagnose the double issue Leeds had in creating chances, namely that Piroe wasn’t looking like an optimal fit for the striker role, and that Aaronson simply wasn’t cutting it in attacking midfield.

arts.ttl: Paul Heckingbottom makes frank Preston North End admission after Leeds United draw
arts.sum: Boss Paul Heckingbottom has spoken of his frustration after his Preston North End team were denied a win at home to Leeds United. "But they kept going and Daniel [Farke] made a lot of changes.

arts.ttl: Leeds United player ratings with Bogle, Piroe and Aaronson poor in Preston draw
arts.sum: Four counts of sloppy defending from Pascal Struijk, Joe Rodon, Jayden Bogle and Illan Meslier were punished, as Brad Potts put the hosts in front. Leeds United returned to the top of the Championship with a last-gasp draw at Preston North End. An own goal from the hosts rescued the Whites.

arts.ttl: 'Mayhem, carnage, chaos!' | Leeds rescue point after late own goal!
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Preston North End and Leeds United.
